intro: Crepis amanica, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Crepis amanica is an important plant in ecological studies due to its role in supporting pollinators and its adaptability to various habitats.
